messages.body:
Mariam,

It was so good to hear from you finally! I wrote to you several times but with no response.

I have some ideas on speeding up progress on the transaction but right now I really need to talk with you about other matters. 

You don't have to tell me that Zane is in love; she may well be but it's not with me. I realize now from her letters that Zane is not really interested in me and I'm really not surprised. Women her age are more interested in the quantity of men around them, not the quality. They're not looking to the future at things like how well a man can support them, or how good a life a man can give them. They just want lots of guys falling all over themselves trying to get close. Well, I'm not interested in convoy duty. 

I confess to having a passion for Nigerian women since you sent me your family pictures. You are all so tall, lithe and beautiful, especially you, Mariam. I think my mistake was to try for one who is obviously too young for me, too immature. What I need most is a mature woman, someone who has experienced life and knows the ways of the world. We can talk more of this later.

Please tell Zane for me that there are no hard feelings on my part but that it just would not have worked between us. She is still welcome to come here to Latvia with Mohammed but I'm afraid we can only be friends, nothing more.

Mariam, what are your plans for coming here to Latvia?

I will write later today regarding the transaction

Love,
Lewd

messages.body:
Thu, 7 Jul 2005

Mariam / Mikhail,

I have given considerable thought to the way this transaction has been going and I think it best that the three of us put our heads together to work out a plan. But first, I think I should introduce the two of you.

Mariam, Mikhail Stroganov is a true gentleman and close friend of mine who has helped me in a number of financial dealings. I would also say that some of the deals appeared to me to be very shaky but he pushed me take a few risks and he turned out to be right every time. He has access to considerable financial resources and personnel and I defer final say to him on any action taken from our end.

Mikhail, this very lovely lady is Mariam Abacha and she is Mohammed's and Zainab's mother. She is the real power behind their family and she likewise has final say on any action taken from her end. She and I began this transaction and have had a close relationship, which I hope to make closer very soon.

Ok, down to business. Despite heroic efforts on the part of everyone involved, we haven't made much progress lately. From reading through what correspondence I have, here's where I think we are:

1. I think our lack of progress has been for a number of reasons, one of which is the fact that Mallam Mohammed did not really think things through when he transferred the consignment to London. Bad move.

2. We had one or more imposters involved. One claimed to be Mallam Mohammed and another was some barrister named Hamster Gerbil. It took some time but I think we owe a debt of gratitude to Mikhail for his excellent job of weeding out the bad guys as quickly as he did. High five on that one, MS!

3. The involvement of the good barrister Clark also seems to have been a bottleneck. As I told you, Mariam, he has been unresponsive and charges extortionate rates for very little effort. I immediately became suspicious when he tried to pad his bill to me with all sorts of unnecessary charges and fees. You may have been somewhat lavish with him in the past, but he's dealing with us now and we want a fair day's work for a fair day's pay.

Considering the amount of money we're dealing with, I think we should strike quickly but with caution. I think we can go ahead and start throwing money at this transaction to get it done and over with. Mikhail, let me ask - I saw mention of Sir Charles Farnes-Barnes in the correspondence - where exactly is he now? I know I would fell much more comfortable with him looking over our shoulders on a deal this big. Can we get some input from him on this? I would even approve using the services of barrister Clark if Sir Charles gives us an ok on him.

These are my thoughts and I look for input from both of you. Please respond quickly so we can get this thing off the dime.

Lewd

ps - Mikhail, I saw something from Hettie Meshuganah in the correspondence. Is she still married?

messages.body:
My Dear Lewis,

Thanks so much for your mail.

I read through your mail and it all amazed me. In the process of our communication, we shall concentrate strictly on the transaction at hand and nothing more.
I agreed with you in the number of reasons raised by you.

1. I shall deal with you alone, you can only take advices from your friends that are already involved. I do not want any one to send me mail apart from you.

2.You should understand that the consignment was hastily taken to London because of the impostor involved. We were afraid of the risk of being track down here in Nigeria. So we have to move the consignment to a safer place were you can pick it up.

3. There was a problem with the Barrister because you refused to have a cordial relationship with him, hence all your correspondences were much more directed to the business.

I agreed that my husband has lavished his money on him in the past but that is not same for now, consulting a lawyer in Nigeria can be very expenses mostly when you are involving a lawyer with high standard.

WAY FORWARD

You should not bother much about the Lawyer or whoever we may contact henceforth. My major concern is to get the job done.

The total money require to conclude this transaction is about 1,850pounds if am right????

What you should be concern with now is the cost of the change over certificate with the company (750pounds).

You should send only that amount (750pounds). I will take care of all other aspect and expenses.

I believe with this all the problems will be over and what we should be talking is Mohammed going to your country for sharing and investment.

Contact Mohammed on how the money be sent to him.

Reply when you receive the mail.
I am actually grateful.
Hajia Mariam

messages.body:
Sun, 10 Jul 2005

Mariam, dear lady,

It is always such a pleasant surprise to find something from you in my inbox, and have I got something for your inbox when you get here.

Mariam, I have always felt that I could talk to you in a straightforward manner and I hope to continue to do so. I somehow have the feeling that you are not being told everything about what has been going on with this transaction and may even have intentionally been given false information.

The consignment was not taken to London because of the imposter that Mikhail was able to eliminate. It was because the diplomat had to attend a meeting there and Mohammed, instead of holding the deposit for a couple more weeks until the diplomat returned, unwisely sent it with him to London. This was not very smart on Mohammed's part and it has only served to complicate matters.

I did not refuse to have a cordial relationship with the barrister and I don't now who told you that. What I did refuse was to let that bloodsucker charge us for a lot of unnecessary crap. All Mohammed and I wanted him to do was to sign a piece of paper as my representative and he starts coming up with all these charges for things that were just not necessary.

I get the strong impression that Mohammed, and quite possibly yourself, do not fully realize what we are dealing with here. Mariam, this is THIRTY MILLION DOLLARS we're talking, and that is some serious centavos! There are so many ways that I can think of that this whole thing could go wrong and I'm sure I haven't thought of everything. This is why we need Mikhail and Sir Charles involved. They have so much more experience in these matters than you or I do and they know what to look out for. Sure, Mikhail is a little gruff at times but it comes from his doing business in that cut-throat Russian business environment. He is as fully committed to this as I am, and I strongly feel that he needs to be in direct contact with you as well as myself. I'm sorry, but I think it quite naive of you to insist that only I correspond with you.

Mariam, I have put a lot of money into this transaction - the hotel room that Mohammed had me reserve for the diplomat came to just over $7,000 and I have sent $2,000 to Zainab. I don't know if there's still a problem with the $2,000 because Ms. Bushburn, my admin assistant, disappeared while I was hunting and I haven't heard from her in several weeks. That's a lot of money spent with no return so far. I don't mind spending money but so far a total of $9,000 of my money has been wasted. For this reason I would like to get the opinions of Mikhail and Sir Charles on each move we make.

I desparately want you and your family here, especially you, but I want us to be rich when you get here.

I hope to hear that you agree with me.
Lewd

I don't know if there's still a problem with the $2,000 because Ms. Bushburn, my admin assistant, disappeared while I was hunting and I haven't heard from her in several weeks. That's a lot of money spent with no return so far. I don't mind spending money but so far a total of $9,000 of my money has been wasted. For this reason I would like to get the opinions of Mikhail and Sir Charles on each move we make.

I desparately want you and your family here, especially you, but I want us to be rich when you get here.

I hope to hear that you agree with me.
Lewd

messages.body:
Dearest Mariam,

Always so nice to hear from you. Really, my day just doesn't start right unless I find something from you in my inbox in the morning.

Mariam, I hate to belabor a point but I feel it's for everyone's benefit, especially your own. This is YOUR money, dear lady, and for you to not want to be totally aware of what is going on disturbs me greatly. I don't know if it's a cultural difference in business practices but I don't feel comfortable with you not in the loop 100%. I know from experience that something this big has got to be a team effort and completely transparent to everyone involved. I don't know if your desire to hear from me alone is because of perhaps feelings that you've developed for me (I hope it is) or because of something that Mikhail might have said but we all have to be in this together.

I will suggest that we institute an 'open communications' policy, similar to what I have with my hotel management partnership. For the remainder of the transaction all correspondence to you, Mohammed or Mikhail will be copied to everyone else, and everyone else should do the same. Henceforth, if you write to me regarding the transaction it should also be copied to Mohammed and Mikhail.

If you want to write to me alone about things outside the transaction then by all means do so. There are some things that you and I shsould keep between ourselves.

Again, hoping for your agreement.
Lewd

messages.body:
Tue, 12 Jul 2005

Zane,

Apparently your mother did not pass on my message to you.

Zane, my dear, I have come to the realization that you and I can never be. When you told me you had just broken off a long relationship I knew that I had caught you on the bounce but at the time it didn't matter. Then I saw how you avoided me and spurned my advances.

You are a very attractive girl, doubtlessly intelligent, but I now feel that our age difference is too much. I need a woman closer to your mother's age, someone who has the experience of life behind her, someone who has lived through it all. A girl your age is into things like discos, cars, parties and threesomes. We may be able to work something out on that last item if Mariam is up for it but I think we have to face reality - we just aren't meant for each other in an exclusive relationship.

I feel terrible making you cry like this but it's better said now. You are still welcome here in Latvia, but I'm afraid only in the company of your mother.

Lewd

messages.body:
Tue, 12 Jul 2005

Dearest Mariam,

I confess to becoming somewhat exasperated at constantly trying to save you from yourself. I am also somewhat dismayed at your questioning my commitment to you as a business partner. Mariam, if I wasn't fully committed I would not have put as much into this as I have. This transaction has been nothing but a bottomless pit for me to throw my money into and a headache from the git-go but I have hung in there.

You say you know exactly where the problem lies, but I wonder if you really do. It is apparent to me that you are misreading several aspects of this situation. One is that you don't seem to be aware that Mikhail is actually your strongest supporter in this transaction. I'm sure you feel he's been abusive but this is his way of determining YOUR commitment. You also owe him a major debt of gratitude for ridding us of imposters who tried to horn in earlier. I could never have done that by myself and all Mohammed did was whine and throw passwords at us.

In private correspondence he has advised me to go ahead with this transaction to it's completion but he, like myself, insist on total and complete transparancy and a team effort. He has the infrastructure in place to prevent further wasting of money without results. We both realize that money has to be spent up front and that is not a problem for either of us. The problem is the amount of money that has been spent to date without results.

If you don't want to cooperate in seeing this to a successful conclusion, I suggest that Mohammed, Mikhail and myself take over the helm and you step back to a position as observer. I would, however, like for you to explain to your son that he must consult with us before he makes ANY move. No more of this sending the consignment halfway around the world on some whim. No more moving targets, it stays where it is until we have it in our possession.

Upon hearing that you are in agreement I will immediately contact Mohammed to determine our next step.

Lewd

messages.body:
Thu, 21 Jul 2005

Dear Mariam, Brother Mohammed, annd Lovely Zainab,

Yes, that's right. All this time you thought you were dicking with us when all along it was YOU being dicked with. But we all had a lot of fun with this, didn't we? I know that Mikhail and I certainly did!

Listen, guys, like Mikhail told you, you're just not cut out for this. Millions of dollars stashed away, barristers, security companies. Gimme a break. You should know by now that nobody believes that crap anymore. Face it, the only people who respond to these 419 scams anymore are people like ourselves who just want to see how long they can keep you scammers dangling on the other end.

I wish I could recommend some sort of alternative employement for you guys but, gosh, from knowing you as well as I have over these past two months I just don't think any of you are bright enough to hold down any kind of honest job. I think maybe you should seriously consider Mikhail's suggestion. You know, the one about your wife and the village elders. 

Ok, the best to all of you but we're done with you, so go away.

Lewd Noogie
Novosibirsk, Latvia

ps - Zainab, my love, I'll miss you the most. You were the best, baby.
